name: Arundo
Relationship: Compare: Anthroxantum - sweet vernal grass (a popular medicine for hay-fever and coryza). Lolium; Cepa; Sabad.; Silica.

Head: Deep seated pain in sides of head
Itching; falling off of hair; roots of hair painful
Pain in occiput, extends to right ciliary region
Pustules
Mouth: Burning and itching; bleeding of gums
Ulcers and exfoliations in the commissaries
Nose: Annoying itching in the nostrils and roof of the mouth
Hay-fever begins with burning and itching of palate and conjunctiva
Female: Neuralgic pains from face to shoulders and pubis
Menses too early and too profuse
Skin: Eczema; itching and crawling, especially of chest, upper extremities
Extremities: Itching, burning; oedema of hands and feet
Copious and offensive sweat of feet
Male: Pain in spermatic cord after embrace
Ears: Burning and itching in auditory canals

details: A remedy for catarrhal states. Hay-fever. Arundo donax seems to be the same: Acts on excretory and generative organs; suppuration, especially chronic, and where the ulceration is fistulous, especially in long bones. Itching eruption on chest, upper extremities and behind ears.
